# Introduction
- This document explores preliminary structural equation models (SEMs) using different response types of plant cover and diversity.
- Results are presented first, with the code example at the end.
  - The left column of SEM diagrams is based on 2021 values. Right column is the difference between 2012 and 2021 (positive values indicate an increase over time).
- Variables:
  - `Width`: channel width, derived from the standard deviation of LiDAR data, which measure elevation difference from 2011 to 2019; measurement is not very accurate.
  - `up.trt`: a categorical variable, indicating if upland treatments were present (Channel 19).
  - `inch.trt`: a categorical variable, indicating if in-channel treatments were present (Channels 13 and 21).
  -`Elev_Diff`: elevation difference from 2011 to 2019, as measured by LiDAR. Some stations could not be measured, so including this variable means the sample size decreases.
  - `OM_perc`: organic matter percent from 2021 soil samples.
  `TN_log`: total nitrogen content from 2021 soil samples, log-transformed to improve normality.
- Response variables (2021 values and the difference between 2012 and 2021):
  - Total cover
  - Herbaceous cover
  - Woody cover
  - Perennial species richness
  - Perennial Shannon diversity
- The data sheet for Channel 19 Station 2 + 4 is missing for 2012, so the station is dropped from all models.

# Code example
```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
library(tidyverse)
library(lavaan)
library(semPlot)

# Load data ---------------------------------------------------------------

dat.2021 <- read.csv("data/cleaned/SEM-input.csv")
dat.2021$inch.trt <- as.factor(dat.2021$inch.trt)
dat.2021$up.trt <- as.factor(dat.2021$up.trt)
```

```{r, fig.width=7, echo=TRUE}
# Total cover -------------------------------------------------------------

# Model 1 (2021 cover)
mod.total01 <- '
  # regressions
    Cover ~ Width + up.trt + inch.trt + Elev_Diff + OM_perc
    OM_perc ~ up.trt + inch.trt
'
fit.total01 <- sem(mod.total01, data = dat.2021, fixed.x = TRUE) 
  # Warning message discussed further here: https://groups.google.com/g/lavaan/c/FzShzsXYNco?pli=1
vartable(fit.total01)
summary(fit.total01, standardized = TRUE)

semPaths(fit.total01, "std", edge.label.cex = 1.3, residuals = FALSE, sizeMan = 7)
```
